ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹658 â€” September 4, 2024 | Read on the web

The Secret Inside One Million Checkboxes â€” One Million Checkboxes is/was a site with one million global checkboxes on it where checking (or unchecking) a box changed it for everyone on the site, instantly. This fun post-mortem digs into how the internet (and, specifically, a group of smart teenagers) played with the project to reach ends you'd neverÂ expect..

Nolen

The Ultimate Guide to Font Performance Optimization â€” This is quite the rabbit hole indeed, but a useful one to go down if your site is using custom fonts and youâ€™re serving them up directly yourself. Of course, step one is to consider sticking to system/web-safe fonts.. ;-)

Anna Monus (DebugBear)

Beyond the 10x Engineer â€” Incredible technical skills canâ€™t save a product that no one wants. Thatâ€™s why engineers should care about non-technical product skills. To help you figure out which of these skills matter, we wrote about the ones we look for (and use) atÂ PostHog.

PostHog sponsor

Supporting AVIF in Google Search â€” Image format AVIF is now a supported file type in Google Search and Google Images, as well as any place that uses images in GoogleÂ Search.

John Mueller (Google)

The Web Design Museum: The First Decade of Web Design â€” Exhibits thousands of unique old website designs from the early 90s to mid-00s. A fun way to discover forgotten trends in webÂ design.

Web Design Museum

Apple 'Appears to Mislead' UK Regulator Over Deceptive Default Browser User Interface â€” Looks like Apple is claiming that a previously implemented pattern for picking default browsers in iOS, in fact, never even existed. ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«

Open Web Advocacy

âš¡ï¸ Quick Links

  • âœ¨ Rachel Andrew from the Chrome team brings us a recent round-up of all that's new to the web platform.

  • â†”ï¸ Firefox 130 adds WebDriver BiDi updates, including browsingContext.navigationFailed event support.

  • âŒ¨ï¸ Server Mono is a neat monospace font inspired by typewriters, ASCII art, and command-line interfaces.

  • ğŸ—³ï¸ ICYMI, the 2024 State of CSS survey is now open and seeking your input.

  • ğŸª² Chrome's bug bounty is now up to $250,000.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

â–¶Â Â Caching Demystified: Inspect, Clear, and Disable Caches â€” Dives into the different types of browser cache and how to inspect and manage them in ChromeÂ DevTools.

Jecelyn Yeen

Finding Two Lines of CSS That Tanked Performance â€” Upon launching the Learn Web Components site, Andrico discovered one of its animations caused a sharp drop in performance on Firefox. Hereâ€™s what he discovered and how he fixedÂ it.

Andrico Karoulla

ğŸ’¡ Andrico has also written about how he improved the screen reader experience for visitors toÂ LearnÂ WCs.

ğŸ—“ï¸Â Join us at ViteConf! â€” On October 3rd & 4th, get ready to learn from the builders pushing modern web development forward. Donâ€™t miss outâ€”get your ticketÂ now!

StackBlitz sponsor

Lazy Loading Isn't Just Lazy, It's Late: We Can Do Better â€” â€œWe tend only to fetch more content as the user scrolls it into view or navigates to the next page, which isnâ€™t just lazy: itâ€™s often late and an awful user experienceâ€. This post suggests a more proactiveÂ approach.

Jupiter Jayna

â–¶Â Â Scroll-Enhanced Experiences â€” A 52-minute journey through the art of 'scrollytelling' with CSS, guiding you through the process of creating dynamic experiences that leverage a userâ€™s scroll behavior. Covers controlling pace/rhythm of a page with the CSS Scroll TimelineÂ API.

Carmen Ansio

'Why I Donâ€™t Block AI Scrapers' â€” â€œlet thieves do thief things until our justice system(s) do justice systemÂ thingsâ€.

Jens Oliver Meiert

How to Quickly (and Weightlessly) Convert Chrome Extensions to Safari â€” Goes into more depth than you mightÂ expect.
Nina Torgunakova

Five HTML Features Youâ€™re Not Using (But Should Be)
Safdar Ali

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools & Resources

Reasonable Colors: An Open-Source Color System for Building Beautiful, Accessible Color Palettes â€” Just drop in the base stylesheet, then use the provided CSS variables that provide built-in â€œshadesâ€ for eachÂ color.

matthew howell

Introducing style-observer, A MutationObserver for CSS â€” Bramus has created a MutationObserver for CSS. It, dubbed style-observer, allows you to attach JavaScript callbacks to changes in computed values of CSSÂ properties.

Bramus Van Damme

Passkeys for Everyone! Make Your User Login Simpler with FusionAuth â€” FusionAuth just added passkeys to their free tier, which is a paid feature for almost every other auth provider. Try it outÂ yourself.

FusionAuth sponsor

The Dev Tools Performance Monitor Panel â€” In Chrome, if you open 'Dev Tools > More Tools > Performance Monitor' youâ€™ll see some helpful high-level charts and graphs of the realtime performance data of yourÂ UI.

Dave Rupert

Avatars: A Collection of Diverse Free Avatar Images â€” Downloadable in PNG format, but also accessible directly via a public CDN and thereâ€™s a Figma pluginÂ available.

alohe

Tailwind Grid Builder: Learn and Build CSS Grids with Tailwind â€” A simple tool to generate the HTML with Tailwind classes for a custom grid. Just select number of items, rows, columns, and number of breakpoints as needed. Useful also for learning the Tailwind classÂ names.

Tailscan

ğŸ And one for fun..

Button Stealer: A Chrome Extension That "Steals" a Button from Every Website You Open â€” A funny way of 'collecting' an inspiration gallery of buttons, which the author has done and you can viewÂ here.

anatoly zenkov

ğŸ‘‹ Hey! Hope you're doing well. I'm back after a week away in Germany, and as such, usual service resumes. Let's get to it.
__
Chris Brandrick, your editor

ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹657 â€” August 28, 2024 | Read on the web

The State of CSS 2024 Survey â€” The increased pace of evolution in the CSS space seems to show no signs of slowing, as such we can now do so much more than we could just a few short years ago (be that advanced math, scroll-triggered animations, etc). As such, this recently launched survey â€”Â which covers things like layout, color, typography, accessibility, and more â€”Â plays an important role in letting browser vendors know what we all think about the path CSS is taking. Be sure to fill it out, and tell em we sent ya. ğŸ˜‰

Devographics

How to Make Your Web Page Faster Before It Even Loads â€” Can we measure the events that happen before the first byte of a web page is received by the browser, and in turn optimize them to make our web pages and apps load evenÂ faster?

Salma Alam-Naylor

Front-End System Design â€” Learn to create scalable, efficient user interfaces in this extensive video course by Evgennii Ray. Explore the box model, browser rendering, DOM manipulation, state management, performance and muchÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Can You Convert a Video to Pure CSS? â€” Can or should..? A highly detailed exploration of using scroll-based animations as a way to play video as just CSS. David has also made a neat browser-based tool for converting any video into a pure CSS keyframe animation ready to be dropped into yourÂ site.
